fields.infoText: We need your consent before using email to communicate

fields.label: Read about the risks of using email
fields.infoText:
HMRC takes the security of personal information very seriously.

The main risks of using email that concern HMRC are as follows:

* Confidentiality/privacy - there is a risk that email sent over the internet may be intercepted.

* Confirming your identity - it is crucial that we only communicate with established business contacts at their correct email addresses.

* There is no guarantee that an email received over an insecure network, like the internet, has not been altered during transit.

* We will desensitise information wherever possible, for example by only quoting part of any unique reference numbers.

sections.title: Do you intend to use VAT Postponed Accounting?
sections.shortName: Intent to use VAT Postponed Accounting

fields.label: Do you intend to use VAT Postponed Accounting?
What is VAT Postponed Accounting?
fields.infoText:
If the UK leaves the EU without an agreement, the government will introduce Postponed Accounting for import VAT on goods brought into the UK.

This means that UK VAT registered businesses importing goods will not pay import VAT at the time the goods arrive at the UK border.
Instead, they will be able to account for import VAT on their VAT return.

This will apply both to imports from the EU and non-EU countries.

sections.title: Do you hold or have access to a Duty Deferment Account (DDA)?

fields.label: Do you hold or have access to a Duty Deferment Account (DDA)?
optionHelpText: Based on your previous answers, you will need to hold or have access to a Duty Deferement Account by the time you submit a declaration that will attract duty

fields.label: What is a Duty Deferment Account?
fields.infoText:
You have to pay VAT and Import Duty when you import goods to the UK. 

You can use the Duty Deferment Scheme (DDS) to make monthly payments to HMRC through a Deferment Approval Number (DAN).

To use the DDS, you have to give HMRC a guarantee through your bank that you can meet the cost of all your VAT and duties.

sections.title: Do you intend to move controlled goods?

fields.label: Do you intend to move controlled goods?
What are controlled goods?
fields.infoText:
Controlled goods require a licence for import or export.

These include:

* military and paramilitary goods
* dual-use technology (civilian goods which can be used for military purposes, like machine tools or marine equipment)
* artworks
* plants and animals
* medicines and chemicals
